text.p: These are the leading stories in the Egyptian press on Sunday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Mubarak says Egypt wants a just and comprehensive peace that will achieve security and equality for all sides; says that a strong Egypt is the pillar of stability in the Middle East.

- President at celebration of October War victory: We salute the October martyrs and our armed forces which have reached the highest levels of proficiency; says the late president Anwar Sadat was a hero who put up with more than any human could to prove that Egypt would always be strong.
- President praises Badr '96 military exercises and says he is pleased and reassured with the capabilities of Egypt's armed forces.
- Mubarak tells armed forces newspaper that the fuss over Egypt's possession of Scud missiles is a game that does not frighten Egypt.

- Mubarak discusses with Arafat the results of the Washington summit and contacts aimed at boosting peace process. Moussa says the two leaders agreed to continue direct coordination to boost the Palestinian position.

- Mubarak says peace depends on Egypt's strength; that strength alone will not guarantee complete security but comprehensive peace can. He says that committment to signed agreements will end fighting.
- Mubarak and Arafat discussed all possibilities following Washington summit ahead of today's negotiations.
- Mubarak tells armed forces newspaper that Israel is the biggest loser from Netanyahu's stance.
- Mubarak lays flowers on tomb of unknown soldier and tombs of Sadat and Nasser at start of October war celebrations.
- Egypt faces Morocco tonight in African cup qualifier.
- Mubarak says the region faces dangerous threats that require a strong defensive capability.
